attributes.action: Condemn Indian government's response to the democratic farming protest in Delhi.
attributes.additional_details:
Indians from across the country are marching on the nation’s capital Delhi, to urge Prime Minister Modi to repeal 3 agricultural bills that will leave farmers open to exploitation.
Protesters have been met with road blocks, tear gas, & water cannons.

Boris Johnson’s comments in response to MP Tan Dhesi question on the 9/12/20, show how uninformed many are, & how necessary it is to shine a light on this issue.

The United Kingdom should be championing the people’s democratic right to protest.
attributes.background:
1. To raise awareness of the protest on an international stage.

2. To re-iterate the importance of protecting the right to peaceful protest to the Indian government.

3. To condemn the Modi government's heavy-handed use of force against Indians exercising their democratic right to protest.
